Arend


So, you want to prove something, huh?


Good for you! You’ll definitely find Arend to be the best way to formalise your proofs.
Jud go ahead and 
install
 it!


Installation




Download the jar and hopefully it will work.


Now define your first 
function
.

Jud go ahead and  install  it!
docs.title: Arend

docs.title: Installation

docs.text:
Arend Tutorial


Here is the data type for booleans in Arend:


\open ::Data::Unit
\open ::Data::Empty

\data Bool | true | false

\function
True (b : Bool) : \Prop
    | true =
 Unit
    | false =
 Empty

\function
not (b : Bool) : Bool
    | true =
 false
    | false =
 true

\function
if {A : \Type} (b : Bool) (then else : A) : A =
 \elim b
    | true =
 then
    | false =
 else
docs.title: Tutorial

docs.text:
Here is the data type for booleans in Arend:  \open ::Data::Unit
\open ::Data::Empty

\data Bool | true | false

\function
True (b : Bool) : \Prop
    | true =  Unit
    | false =  Empty

\function
not (b : Bool) : Bool
    | true =  false
    | false =  true

\function
if {A : \Type} (b : Bool) (then else : A) : A =  \elim b
    | true =  then
    | false =  else
docs.title: Arend Tutorial

docs.text:
There are three kinds of definitions in Arend.


Function


Use the 
\function
 keyword.


Data


Use the 
\data
 keyword.


Class


Use the 
\class
 keyword.
docs.title: Definitions
